result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Adam DeMaster

defendant.name: DeMaster, Joshua Adam

10:26 AM Defendant Joshua Adam DeMaster in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Joshua Adam DeMaster.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel informs the court that defendant's ride broke down and that is why he missed last appearance. Counsel still awaiting blood results.  State requesting a date in January.
Further proceedings scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Joshua Adam DeMaster not in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Joshua Adam DeMaster.  Attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dvoran just received a message from her client that his ride fell through and unable to appear. Court notes message in court file that defendant contacted Clerk of Courts office. Counsel has been maintaining contact with her client. State requests warrant. Court will issue warrant but stay it until next hearing.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant called stating car broke down and defendant is unable to appear (10:18 am).  Forwarded to clerk.

records.addlTxt: State's

(AMENDED FROM $3000.00 CASH) same conditions remain in effect. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Copy of information provided to counsel who waives reading and enters a not guilty plea. Bail motion heard. State opposes. Court will amend bail to $2000.00 cash with previous conditions remaining in effect.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Adam DeMaster appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Joshua Adam DeMaster. Counsel waives reading of complaint. Waiver of preliminary hearing form to be filed after hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:18pm Atty Dvoran emailed clerk advising she will be appointed to this case and requests date for bail motion to be heard. Clerk gave 3/24/22 at 9:30am

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua Adam DeMaster appeared by video from OZSD, in custody. Defendant has requested to speak with public defender but has not heard anything back. Atty Dvoran in court and will meet with defendant. Court finds good cause to extend timelimits.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua Adam DeMaster appeared by video, Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz appeared in court for Joshua Adam DeMaster.  Defendant will hire private counsel.  Court finds probable cause.  State recommends $5,000 cash bail.  Counsel as to bail.  Court sets bail.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits and sets for status on preliminary hearing.
